# Website Accessibility

If you use assistive technology (such as a Braille reader, or a screen reader) and the format of any material on this website interferes with your ability to access information, please [contact us](/contactus). To enable us to respond in a manner most helpful to you, please indicate the nature of your accessibility problem, the preferred format in which to receive the material, the web address of the requested material, and your contact information.

## Accessibility Design Guidelines

Our website has been designed with the following accessibility guidelines in mind:

  * We work to comply with [Section 508](https://www.section508.gov/) as well as [WCAG 2.0 A and AA](https://www.w3.org/WAI/intro/wcag) referring to website accessibility standards.
  * If you have difficulty accessing the site or have any comments or feedback, please do not hesitate to [contact us](/contactus).

## Browser Accessibility Information

Many popular browsers contain built-in accessibility tools.

  * [Chrome Accessibility Information](https://www.google.com/accessibility/all-products-features.html)
  * [Firefox Accessibility Information](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/accessibility-features-firefox)
  * [Microsoft Edge Accessibility Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-...

#  Farmington Museum 

**3041 E Main Street, Farmington, NM 87402 • (505) 599-1174 •[](https://www.facebook.com/FarmingtonMuseumNM)**

**Hours of Operation:**  
Museum Services - Monday-Saturday • 10:00 am to 5:00 pm

 _Groups by appointment only_

**Admission:** Donations welcome, some traveling exhibits may require an entrance fee. 

Lecture series, performances, workshops, and special demonstrations are offered year-round. The museum store features exhibit-related merchandise, books on local and regional interests, toys, and educational materials.

### Objects Tell Stories

**On Display in the Big Gallery through March 2026**

The Farmington Museum’s collection is filled with fascinating treasures that capture the spirit of our community’s past. From antique furniture and vintage clothing to retro technology and unique works of art, each piece reveals a glimpse into the lives, creativity, and culture that shaped Farmington. Many of these artifacts are rarely displayed—explore our staff’s favorite picks and discover the stories they have to tell. FREE ADMISSION. 

[](https://www.facebook.com/FarmingtonMuseumNM/)
